body_html:
@SsnL The default I mentioned above is when we generating the function signature for native function, for the argument who have python_default_init, the argument default in that function signature will always be "None", which I think should not be the case as we see here:

pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/native_functions.yaml

Line 1556 in ce0b895

p: 2

In norm, p has a default value of 2 in python_default_init, so when generating the function signature, the argument should have a default value of 2 rather than None (which is the current case).
body_text:
@SsnL The default I mentioned above is when we generating the function signature for native function, for the argument who have python_default_init, the argument default in that function signature will always be "None", which I think should not be the case as we see here:

  
    
      pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/native_functions.yaml
    
    
         Line 1556
      in
      ce0b895
    
    
    
    

        
          
           p: 2 
        
    
  


In norm, p has a default value of 2 in python_default_init, so when generating the function signature, the argument should have a default value of 2 rather than None (which is the current case).
